question_text: What is a binary tree?
student_answer: A binary tree is a set of nodes that is either empty or partitioned into a root node and one or two subsets that are binary subtrees of the root. Each node has at most two children, the left child and the right child.
model_answer: A binary tree is a tree for which the maximum number of children per node is two.

student_answer: A binary tree is a tree where every parent has only two children.

question_text: What is a binary search tree?
student_answer: A binary search tree is a tree that is set up so that it can be easily searched for numbers based on the location compared to the previous nodes.
model_answer: A binary search tree is a binary tree that has the property that for any node the left child is smaller than the parent which in turn is smaller than the right child.

question_text: What is the inorder traversal of a binary tree?
student_answer: The inorder traversal of a binary tree visits the node of a binary tree in order according to their data values.
model_answer: The inorder traversal of a binary tree is traverse the left subtree, then the root, then the right subtree.

question_text: What is the inorder traversal of a binary tree?

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: Unlike regular functions, constructors are only used to initialize an object's data when it is created. Constructors must also be given the same name as the class and cannot return any values.
model_answer: A constructor is called whenever an object is created , whereas a function needs to be called explicitly . Constructors do not have return type, but functions have to indicate a return type.

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: A constructor initializes an object or objects of a class. A function of a class performs a task such as display a line of text or do some kind of mathematical operations.

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: A constructor is a function used to initialize an object's data when it is created . Its call is made implicitly when the object is created and must be defined with the same name as the class. Constructor also cannot return a value like a function can.
model_answer: A constructor is called whenever an object is created , whereas a function needs to be called explicitly . Constructors do not have return type, but functions have to indicate a return type.

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: A constructor is used to create an instance of a class and has the same name as that class. A function cannot have the same name as a class and computes data .

gap: Constructors do not have return type, but functions have to indicate a return type

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: A constructor is used to create an object that can be employed in the main function of a program. This may or may not execute code along with it. A function is a set of code that executes when called , but does not create a new object.

gap: Constructors do not have return type, but functions have to indicate a return type

question_text: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
student_answer: The compiler distinguishes overloaded functions by their signatures. It encodes each function identifier with the number and types of its parameters to generate type-safe linkage, which ensures the proper overloaded function is called.
model_answer: Overloaded functions are differentiated by the compiler based on the function signature. When an overloaded function is called , the compiler will find the function whose signature is closest to the given function call.

question_text: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
student_answer: Overloaded functions are distinguished by their signatures, Name mangling or name decoration, and type-safe linkage ensures that proper overloaded functions is called and types of the arguments conform to types of the parameters.
model_answer: Overloaded functions are differentiated by the compiler based on the function signature. When an overloaded function is called , the compiler will find the function whose signature is closest to the given function call.

question_text: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?
student_answer: Overloaded functions must have the same return type but different input parameters.
model_answer: Overloaded functions are differentiated by the compiler based on the function signature. When an overloaded function is called , the compiler will find the function whose signature is closest to the given function call.
gap: When an overloaded function is called, the compiler will find the function whose signature is closest to the given function call

question_text: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler?

Overloading the concept of providing different meaning to a object based on the context of its presence. Overloading is one type of polymorphism and this is also a feature in programming.

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function?
student_answer: All constructors are functions but not all functions are constructors. Also functions can have nearly infinite purposes, while constructors always create an instance of whichever class one is using. One can change how a constructor does something but not what it does. With functions one can change not only the how but also the what.

question_text: Where are variables declared in a C plus plus program?
student_answer: Variables are declared before they are actually used . They can be declared before main ( ) to use globally.
model_answer: Variables can be declared anywhere in a program. They can be declared inside a function ( local variables ) or outside the functions ( global variables ).

question_text: Where are variables declared in a C plus plus program?
student_answer: Variables can be declared globally just before the main method ( but also outside of it ). Alternatively, variables can be subject to only the method they are scoped within, but would still be declared at the beginning of that method ( but inside of it ).
model_answer: Variables can be declared anywhere in a program. They can be declared inside a function ( local variables ) or outside the functions ( global variables ).

question_text: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
student_answer: A local variable cannot be accessed outside the function in which it is declared . Data members normally are private. Variables of functions declared private are accessible only to member functions of the class in which they are declared .
model_answer: Data members can be accessed from any member functions inside the class defintion. Local variables can only be accessed inside the member function that defines them.

question_text: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
student_answer: A function prototype tells the compiler the function name, return type and the number and type of parameters without revealing the implementations contained in the function definition.
model_answer: A function prototype includes the function signature, i. e., the name of the function, the return type, and the parameters's type. The function definition includes the actual body of the function.

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: Static arrays are those with a declared size , that is known to the program. Non static arrays leave the size undeclared and open so it can be assigned later . Usually they are used for input purposes.

question_text: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
student_answer: The FUNCTION PROTOTYPE is where the programmer declares that he or she is using a function other than main ( ) . This is like declaring a variable. The programmer knows that he or she will be using in the future, but has yet to say where they are going to use it, or how. This answers the question who, it gives the function a name and character. The function prototype, by common practice is placed at the beginning of the program after the includes and before main ( ) . The FUNCTION DEFINITION is the guts of the function.
model_answer: A function prototype includes the function signature, i. e., the name of the function, the return type, and the parameters's type. The function definition includes the actual body of the function.
gap: A function prototype includes the return type, and the parameters's type

question_text: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: A static array will store the new values that were assigned to each of its elements. Meaning if you call a function twice it will use the last values that were returned the first time. If you do not declare it static then the new values will not be stored and will be reset to their original value.
model_answer: The arrays declared as static live throughout the life of the program. They are initialized only once, when the function that declares the array is first called.

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: A static local array exists for the duration of the program and its elements are initialized to 0 if not explicitly initialized. So a static local array 's elements will still be the same when called later unless specifically initialized to something else. This does not happen for automatic arrays.
model_answer: The arrays declared as static live throughout the life of the program. They are initialized only once, when the function that declares the array is first called.

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: When one declares array static the array is not destroyed after the function is over. When an array is not declared as static, the array is created and initialized every time a function calls it.
model_answer: The arrays declared as static live throughout the life of the program. They are initialized only once, when the function that declares the array is first called.

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
